snippet: The filing by SunGard, a financial software provider, is another example of private equity firms’ seeking to take advantage of buoyant stock markets.
abstract: Financial software provider SunGard files for initial public offering; move comes roughly one decade after company was acquired by consortium of investment firms during flush period for private equity.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: The filing by SunGard, a financial software provider, is another example of private equity firms’ seeking to take advantage of buoyant stock markets.

headline.main: SunGard Files to Go Public After a Decade Owned by Private Equity
headline.print_headline: I.P.O. Filing by SunGard After 10 Years
